Iconic. The way its able to be simple yet effective is a large part of what makes Portal remain timeless to this day. Once you understand the game it can be rather short so replayability isn't the highest (second playthrough took me around a hour and 7mins). Another con would be trying to play the game in commentary mode, the audio mixing isn't the best so it was hard for me to even hear most of the commentary bubbles. Beyond that I believe its a game that should be played by everyone at least once. No need to wait for a sale.

Good for people who like to complete puzzles with some story to it. Can be beaten pretty quick, but still very fun and worth the time. If you think Portal will be short, as my time is how long it took for me to complete, there is a sequel, "Portal 2." Portal 2 is a lot longer than the first and has a nice follow through story and puzzles. 8/10 really good!

Overall Would Recommend...

Portal Was One Of The First Games I Played On PC... Still Remains A Classic Eveyone Loves...

If You Love Puzzle Games And Being Tormented By A Sarcastic Robot Who Offers You Cake... Then Have I Got I Got A Game For You... 

Has Great Graphics That Hold up Even After 15 Years... Controls Are Easy To Understand And You Can Play Both Keyboard And Mouse Or Controller.

Overall Would Recommend 8/10... Don't Trust The Cake...

As someone who never played the classics while growing up during the 2000s, i always knew Portal was one of the most reputable games of it's age and genre.
I decided now was a good time to give it a proper playthrough of my own, during a time where most current games nowadays simply get boring very fast.

As someone who doesn't get out of his way to normally play puzzle games, i found myself enjoying Portal very much!
As you progress, the things you learn and utilize during the latter stages can be bent and twisted, allowing for multiple ways of completing the levels, i've noticed, since i am certain the ways i've finished some levels were in an unorthodox way. This really adds to the feeling of accoplishment when you figure something out and allows for a lot more sporadic thinking from all kinds of people!
I enjoyed every level and the story of the game was incredibly captivating. Every level would make you question things again and again, as things seemed to be off. Everything culminates wonderfully and sets things up for a sequel! 

Overall, i really enjoyed the first installment of the Portal-series and am eager to see what the "ground-breaking and revolutionary" Portal 2 game has to offer.

10/10.

Portal

Positives:
+ Fun and challenging puzzles
+ Good mental training
+ Nice physics
+ Good graphics
+ Nice sound and music
+ The humour
+ The end credits song "Still alive"

Negatives:
- The cake is a lie
- Little variation in level design
- Can feel a bit frustrating if youre temporary stuck/havent got the hang of the game yet
- Quite short length (but helped by a longer level 19)

Total Score: 8.5/10

I came into this game expecting the cake to be a lie, however, I was deeply disappointed to find out this is in fact NOT true. You can clearly see the cake and therefore it is not a lie and I have been lied to by countless YouTubers. The correct phrase would be "The cake is incinerated by a rouge AI."
